elements.name: question1
elements.title: What is Paul Watzlawick's insight? Please add. We can ...

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What can poor communication do in business? Name three consequences.
elements.correctAnswer: Misunderstandings, extra work, damage to image, financial losses

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Into which two areas is verbal communication divided?

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What is non-verbal communication? Give three examples.
elements.correctAnswer: Facial expressions, gestures, gaze, posture, external appearance

elements.name: question5
elements.title: What is paraverbal communication? Give three examples.
elements.correctAnswer: Voice pitch, volume, speaking style, speaking tempo, speech melody, pronunciation

elements.name: question6
elements.title: What is meant by "congruence between the what and the how" in relation to communication?
elements.correctAnswer: Consistency between what you say and how you say it.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: What should you pay attention to in terms of posture? Name three points in keywords.
elements.correctAnswer: Upright, calm (not swaying), relaxed shoulders, centered arms, hands above the edge of the table

elements.name: question8
elements.title: What should you look out for in gestures? Name three points in keywords.
elements.correctAnswer: Small, calm arm movements, open arm position, do not hold objects, do not scratch yourself, do not adjust your hairstyle

elements.name: question9
elements.title: Why should breaks be used deliberately, for example during a lecture?
elements.correctAnswer: They enable eye contact and increase the audience's attention.

elements.name: question10
elements.title: What should I look out for in my hairstyle, for example when talking to customers?
elements.correctAnswer: It should not interfere with talking and should not hinder eye contact.
